solution_line_template: Melony makes ${profit_per_3_shirts} * {sandals_profit_multiplier} = $<<{profit_per_3_shirts}*{sandals_profit_multiplier}={profit_for_2_sandals}>>{profit_for_2_sandals} of profit for two pairs of sandals.
Melony makes ${profit_for_2_sandals} / {num_sandals_for_profit} pairs = $<<{profit_for_2_sandals}/{num_sandals_for_profit}={profit_per_sandal}>>{profit_per_sandal} of profit per pair of shoes.
Melony makes ${profit_per_3_shirts} / {num_shirts_for_profit} shirts = $<<{profit_per_3_shirts}/{num_shirts_for_profit}={profit_per_shirt}>>{profit_per_shirt} of profit per shirt.
For {shirts_to_sell} shirts, Melony will make {shirts_to_sell} shirts * ${profit_per_shirt} = $<<{shirts_to_sell}*{profit_per_shirt}={profit_from_shirts}>>{profit_from_shirts} of profit.

For {sandals_to_sell} pairs of sandals, Melony will make {sandals_to_sell} pairs * ${profit_per_sandal}/pair = $<<{sandals_to_sell}*{profit_per_sandal}={profit_from_sandals}>>{profit_from_sandals} of profit.
Melony will make a total of ${profit_from_shirts} + ${profit_from_sandals} = $<<{profit_from_shirts}+{profit_from_sandals}={total_profit}>>{total_profit} of profit.
